channel.title: XXE on Abdelrhman Allam
channel.description: Recent content in XXE on Abdelrhman Allam

item.title: XML external entity
item.description: XML external entity injection (also known as XXE) is a web security vulnerability that allows an attacker to interfere with an application’s processing of XML data. It often allows an attacker to view files on the application server filesystem, and to interact with any back-end or external systems that the application itself can access. XXEs can be very impactful bugs, as they can lead to confidential information disclosure, SSRFs, and DoS attacks.
